div.p: R68/380, unit 343, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.
Returned with best thanks. I have not signed the receipt, thinking that Mr Undersecretary Moore would be pleased to sign it

Ferd. von Mueller
On 13 December 1867, the Government of India sent two copies ofBeddome (1866-68), fascicle 17, for the 'Colonial Secretary' of Victoria. These reached the Chief Secretary's Office in Melbournein mid-January 1868andwereforwarded to M, apparently without a standard transmission letter, but enclosing the form of receipt required by the Government of Madras.Moore annotated the file on 17 January: 'Forward receipt with thanks. 'There were other instances when the Madras receipt form was enclosed with the items and transmittal letter, see for example, M to J. Moore, 18 May 1868 (in this edition as 68-05-18b).
